p.s: Sonnet 60, written by William Shakespeare and published in 1609 is about the aspect of time and how valuable it is in different parts of life.
This sonnet wants to address the topic, that every minute with your loved one is special and valuable because everything one day comes to an end.
Furthermore are topics like beauty standards in the Elizabethan Era, the process of developing to a mature individual and the aspect of respecting and loving a person from within concluded.
The sonnet of 14 lines falls into the typical structures of Shakespear'sShakespeare's sonnets since it is subdivided into three quatrainquatrains and a heroic couplet in the end.
The quatrains contain a cross rhyme following the rhyme scheme ABAB CDCD EFEF GG.
The Shakespearean sonnet is written in an iambic pentameter, which reminds with its unstressed and stressed rythmrhythm and monotonous sounds of a heart beat.
The authorsauthor's train of thoughts corresponds to the structure produced by this very natural rhyme scheme and therefore functions as a remedy to follow.
To emphasise the natural sound of his sonnet, William Shakespeare makes use of a cross rhyme.
Additionally he also lets his sentence sometimes run into the next line (ll. 9-10).
Which is called a red-on line.
Or uses engjambmentsenjambements like in linelines 10 to 11.
He ends the scene with a heroic couplet to make a statement.
